timeline.bodyText: I think you only need to check new parent against the existing parents, right? If we're running this every time a new ScopeMap is created, it will get them all.
timeline.author: boulter

replies.bodyText: So are you suggesting storing all the parents in a Set on the ScopeMap? Either way we have to run up the parent tree in the constructor.
replies.author: kacperadach

replies.bodyText: yeah, I was thinking just run up the whole parent tree in the constructor. I think that will take a trivial amount of time.
replies.author: boulter

replies.bodyText: Should I add a config to enable/disable this check?
replies.author: kacperadach

replies.bodyText: I can't think of a reason why you'd want to turn it off.
replies.author: boulter

timeline.bodyText: I see we use ENGINE_LOG everywhere else in jinjava, should we keep using that?
timeline.author: hs-lsong

timeline.message: only check if current parent is in parent tree
